From johnny at centos.org  Tue Aug  5 22:01:05 2014
From: johnny at centos.org (Johnny Hughes)
Date: Tue, 05 Aug 2014 17:01:05 -0500
Subject: [CentOS-announce] CESA-2014:1008 Important CentOS 7 samba Security
	Update
In-Reply-To: <20140805200929.GA57368@n04.lon1.karan.org>
References: <20140805200929.GA57368@n04.lon1.karan.org>
Message-ID: <53E15421.8080107@centos.org>

NOTE:  The SUBJ should have been CentOS 7, not CentOS 6 for this update.

On 08/05/2014 03:09 PM, Johnny Hughes wrote:
> 
> CentOS Errata and Security Advisory 2014:1008 Important

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

There was a problem with these packages, and were accidentally shipped
unsigned. I've now redone the process and validated, signed rpms are
on the mirror network.

there is another announcement with the right hash's following this email.

From arrfab at centos.org  Fri Aug 29 12:38:04 2014
From: arrfab at centos.org (Fabian Arrotin)
Date: Fri, 29 Aug 2014 14:38:04 +0200
Subject: [CentOS-announce] lists.centos.org scheduled migration
Message-ID: <5400742C.2010806@centos.org>

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Hi,

We'd just like to inform you that the current machine hosting all the
CentOS mailing lists (on http://lists.centos.org) needs to be replaced
and so the mailman service needs to be moved/migrated to a new host.

Migration is scheduled for Monday September 1st, 7:30 AM, UTC time.
You can convert to local time with $(date -d '2014-09-01 07:30 UTC')

Expected downtime is ~1 hour but we hope to be able to restart the
service earlier.

If you have questions, comments or feedback, please join the
#centos-devel channel on irc.freenode.net.

Kind Regards,

- -- 

Fabian Arrotin
The CentOS Project | http://www.centos.org
gpg key: 56BEC54E | twitter: @arrfab
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v2.0.22 (GNU/Linux)

iEYEARECAAYFAlQAdCwACgkQnVkHo1a+xU5LnACeL2+2OX1o7qqK6zwDq6zPPQSA
2QsAnAuylNkFbqAccwBslS3Y11Cd0ohP
=TinJ
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
